title: Jobs Aren’t Slowing Enough Yet to Slow Down the Fed
sub_head: Friday’s employment report showed slower growth, but not enough to stave off summer interest-rate hikes
body:
America’s job market really does look like it is slowing down. It remains way over the Federal Reserve’s speed limit, though.
The Labor Department on Friday said that the economy added 390,000 jobs last month, down from April’s 436,000 and the slimmest gain in over a year. Over the past three months there have been 1.2 million jobs added—a marked step down from December when the rolling three-month gain came to 1.9 million.
